item.title: Stellar Blade: Complete Edition Officially Announced
item.description:
Summary

  • Stellar Blade will release a Complete Edition with new outfits and a boss fight on PS5 and PC in June.
  • Sony leaked the PC launch date for Stellar Blade through a trailer on YouTube, confirming a June 11 release.
  • Updates in the Complete Edition include 25 new outfits, a new boss fight, and Japanese and simplified Chinese voiceovers.

Stellar Blade will be releasing a Complete Edition for both PlayStation 5 and PC, adding new outfits, an additional boss fight, and more to the action-adventure game. Fans can expect to see the new edition of Stellar Blade launching in June, alongside the launch of the game on PC.

Earlier this week, Sony leaked the PC launch date for Stellar Blade through a trailer that was uploaded to the official PlayStation YouTube channel. The trailer was presumably made public prematurely, as it was taken down shortly thereafter, but it is now available for viewing again. While it reveals much about what visual and performance options will be available for the PC version of the game, it also confirms the PC release date is scheduled for June 11.

Along with that release date confirmation present in the trailer, Gematsu reports that this release will be the game's Complete Edition, and that it will be available on both platforms. Those who already own the version of the game originally released for PlayStation 5 won't have to worry about making additional purchases, as the additional content will be added through a free update. This version of the game includes 25 new Stellar Blade Nano Suits, a new boss fight, and voiceover options for Japanese and simplified Chinese, along with updated facial animations that will sync with whichever vocal track players are using.

Stellar Blade Complete Edition Additional Content

  • 25 New Outfits
  • New Boss Fight
  • Simplified Chinese and Japanese voiceovers

Some of the additions in the upcoming edition of the game had been announced as early as February, though they had originally been teased as arriving in an upcoming DLC for Stellar Blade . This initial reveal, which included crossover content with Goddess of Victory: Nikke and was shown off at the State of Play presentation on February 12, showed that the DLC had also been slated for a June release. However, reveals for the Complete Edition indicate that the content planned for release in the June DLC will be provided in the new edition of the game, alongside the Nier: Automata crossover content that was added last November.

Players can also look forward to a new Stellar Blade boss fight as they face off against Sentil leader Mann. According to the PlayStation Blog, Mann, who is also the bodyguard of Orcal and guardian of Xion, will arrive to test Eve's worthiness using his combat expertise and mastery of weapons. Conquering Mann in combat also appears to be the method required to unlock one of the Complete Edition's new Nano Suits.

item.title: Black Ops 6 & Warzone: All CODE Got Your Six Event Rewards
item.description:
Black Ops 6 and Warzone Season 3 have seen their fair share of limited-time events, each bringing a variety of cosmetic rewards, weapons, and other goodies for players to unlock. While Season 3 is reaching its final days, it still has one more event up its sleeve—one that allows players to show their support for veterans.

While the Blaze of Glory Event has come to a close and the High Art Event Pass is set to end on May 22, players still have one more event to look forward to as Season 3 winds down. The Call of Duty Endowment: Got Your Six Event has officially launched in both Black Ops 6 and Warzone , bringing with it a lineup of free rewards for players to earn. Here’s a guide to the CODE: Got Your Six Event in Black Ops 6 and Warzone .

How Does The CODE: Got Your Six Event Work In Black Ops 6 & Warzone?

Unlike many previous events that simply required players to rack up XP or collect special item drops, the CODE: Got Your Six Event is a challenge-based event. To participate, players must complete a series of challenges, all of which can be tracked via the CODE: Got Your Six page in the Events Tab.

These challenges span across Multiplayer, Zombies, and Warzone, but players will only need to complete one of the three available challenges for each reward. Each challenge also yields an XP reward, and if players claim each one, they will unlock an additional special Mastery Reward for their efforts.

All CODE: Got Your Six Event Rewards In Black Ops 6 & Warzone

There are a total of eight rewards that players can earn as part of the CODE: Got Your Six Event. Seven of these are unlocked by completing individual challenges, while the eighth is a Mastery Reward granted for completing them all. Here’s a breakdown of how to unlock each reward:

Reward

Challenges (Complete 1 To Unlock)

Team Rally (Animated Emblem)

  • Earn 5,000 Score ( BO6 MP)
  • Extract 105,000 Essence (Zombies)
  • Loot 40 Caches ( Warzone )

Covered Sixes (Animated Calling Card)

  • Win 5 Matches ( BO6 MP)
  • Complete 40 Rounds (Zombies)
  • Complete 5 Matches ( Warzone )

Embattled (Spray)

  • Intercept 15 projectiles with Trophy Systems or restock 15 teammates with Assault Packs ( BO6 MP)
  • Open 20 doors (Zombies)
  • Restock 15 teammates with the Muntions Box, Armor Box, or Utility Box ( Warzone )

1-Hour Double XP Token

  • Call in 20 UAVs or Counter UAVs ( BO6 MP)
  • Use Frenzied Guard 40 times (Zombies)
  • Activate 10 UAVs or Counter UAVs ( Warzone )

Reinforced (Weapon Sticker)

  • Destroy 15 Scorestreaks, Equipment, or Field Upgrades ( BO6 MP)
  • Use Healing Aura 10 times (Zombies)
  • Complete 7 Contracts ( Warzone )

1-Hour Double Weapon XP Token

  • Get 5 Saviour Medals ( BO6 MP)
  • Get 150 kills after reloading with Speed Cola Active (Zombies)
  • Buy back or revive 5 players ( Warzone )

Plated Pride (Weapon Charm)

  • Get the highest score in a match ( BO6 MP)
  • Get 350 kills with a Pack-a-Punched weapon (Zombies)
  • Purchase 5 Loadout Drops ( Warzone )

All Chipped Out (AMES 85 Weapon Blueprint)

  • Earn 7 CODE: Got Your Six Event rewards

How To Unlock The All Chipped Out Blueprint In Black Ops 6 & Warzone

The All Chipped Out Blueprint is the Mastery Reward for the CODE: Got Your Six Event in Black Ops 6 and Warzone . To unlock it, players must earn every reward tied to the event during its limited runtime. Once all rewards have been claimed, the All Chipped Out Blueprint for the AMES 85 will be unlocked, allowing players to equip it in both Black Ops 6 and Warzone .

The CODE: Got Your Six Event is currently set to run until the end of Season 3, with its end date scheduled for May 29 at 9 AM PT. Since all rewards are cosmetic, it’s unlikely they’ll return at a later date.

item.title: Grand Theft Auto 6 Fans Think Lucia Is Related to a GTA 4 Character
item.description:
Summary

  • Fans speculate on Lucia's connection to Luis Lopez in GTA 6, hinting at possible family ties.
  • Some fans have explained how the character could be the daughter of Ernesto Lopez, Luis' brother.
  • Lucia's origin in Liberty City and fighting skills hint at her potential link to Luis Lopez.

Grand Theft Auto 6 fans have devised a new theory with credible evidence that suggests Lucia Caminos, one of the game's two main protagonists, may be related to Luis Lopez, the protagonist of Grand Theft Auto 4: The Ballad of Gay Tony ​​​​​​. After a huge info dump from Rockstar Games last week, Grand Theft Auto 6 fans have been delving into all of the new screenshots and footage and discovering tons of references, easter eggs, and more.

Developer and publisher Rockstar Games shocked the gaming world last week when it finally released the second trailer for Grand Theft Auto 6 . The highly anticipated title was initially set to launch in Fall 2025, but was delayed earlier this month to May 26, 2026. While the news came as a huge blow to fans patiently waiting for the next GTA game, Rockstar gave fans plenty to analyze in the meantime with a massive info dump on its website alongside the new trailer. The studio revealed tons of new information regarding the game's characters, locations, and more, with over 70 new screenshots for players to check out too.

GTA 6 Fans Have an Interesting Theory About Lucia

Grand Theft Auto 6 will introduce Jason and Lucia as two new characters to the world of GTA , but some fans are convinced that Lucia is actually related to Luis Lopez, a character from Grand Theft Auto 4 and protagonist of Grand Theft Auto 4: The Ballad of Gay Tony ​​​​​​. Lucia's full backstory is currently unknown, but some believe she could be the daughter of Ernesto Lopez, Luis' brother. While Lucia and Ernesto do have different last names, some are speculating that Lucia is using her mother's name, as she may have cut ties with her father.

Rockstar Games has also confirmed that Lucia was originally from Liberty City, but moved away for an unknown reason. This solidifies the theory even further, as Ernesto, who has two unnamed children, was also in Liberty City but moved away to start a family. Plus, if that wasn't enough, Lucia was taught to fight by her father, and given Luis and Ernesto's background, that also lines up. Finally, to further fuel speculation, fans noticed that the alleged actress for Lucia, Manni L. Perez follows Mario D'Leon, the actor for Luis, on Instagram.

Of course, all of this remains merely speculation, but with so many wild Grand Theft Auto 6 theories floating around the internet, this seems like the most plausible one yet. Some fans speculate that Lucia is the daughter of Luis, but the character does not make any reference to having a daughter during Ballad of Gay Tony . Lucia's age is also unknown, which is a major factor in working out who her father could be.

Should the theory turn out to be true, it wouldn't be the first connection to a past title. Fans recently discovered a massive easter egg in the game's second trailer that connects Michael from GTA 5 to Grand Theft Auto 6 . Eagle-eyed viewers noticed that Michael's movie, Meltdown, can be seen in the background of a new GIF for Grand Theft Auto 6 , leading many to speculate on the character's connection to the upcoming title.

item.title: Helldivers 2’s New Weapon Customization is Hopefully a First Step Toward Armor Transmog
item.description:
In what is sure to be the biggest contribution to progression and customization in quite a while, Helldivers 2 has celebrated the Illuminate’s ensuing onslaught by introducing full-scale weapon customization/personalization. Indeed, nearly all primary weapons in Helldivers 2 now have numbered levels that players increase via gameplay, and at certain levels players unlock customization options for that specific weapon, encouraging players to display mastery of their preferred firearms with attachment modifications and colorway pattern swaps.

Players should not expect all primaries, whether currently in Helldivers 2 or added in the future, to have customizable attachments, as is made evident by the R-2124 Constitution or the FLAM-66 Torcher.

It’ll now be great to see what customization options become available for guns from now on. Plus, while a rigid customization system for Helldivers 2 ’s secondary weapons may not be feasible given how unique they all are, weapon customization in general could be a positive sign that customization for armor isn’t completely out of the realm of possibility at some point. If so, transmog suddenly has a real possibility of finally seeping its way into Helldivers 2 .

Helldivers 2’s Weapon Customization Breathes New Life into Progression

Anyone who’s stuck with Helldivers 2 a year after its launch and has adored each new Premium Warbond and update will likely be at least marginally familiar with the game’s wide catalog of primary weapons, much less have decided what their preferred firearms are. Every new Warbond bearing a primary weapon bundles with it the opportunity for players to reconsider what their favorites are, and yet a lot of time does go by between Warbonds anyhow.

Thankfully, players are about to get a lot more out of almost every primary weapon they have access to with bountiful customizations, meaning they can try out every firearm and level it up as an additional means of optional progression. Depending on the gun, Helldivers 2 ’s weapon attachment customization includes any one or more of the following modification categories:

  • Optics
  • Underbarrel
  • Muzzle
  • Magazine

Ironically, the R-2 Amendment earned in Helldivers 2 ’s Masters of Ceremony Warbond is light on customization options as it only has an Optics category and the same ubiquitous paint job patterns.

Helldivers 2’s Armor Deserves Customization, Too, But Beggars Can’t Be Choosers

Customization on this scale is fairly unprecedented and, while it’s too early to say with any guarantee or even an inkling of it being in the pipeline, it’s thrilling to imagine what Helldivers 2 may consider regarding other customization avenues in-game. Helldivers 2 does not feature transmog because the armor passive a player has is illustrated by the body armor’s appearance. Still, with weapon customization as a neat framework, transmog may not be wholly impractical.

To be fair, attachment customization doesn’t affect how the guns themselves behave aside from incredibly subtle tweaks to stats that aren’t likely to be all that noticeable, allowing such customizations to be rather ornamental. For armor to have transmog capabilities, then, would confirm what Arrowhead CEO Johan Pilestedt has explained, as it would throw players’ assumptions of what their squadmates are wearing into disarray. Of course, not knowing what passives others may have isn’t a make-or-break scenario and never has been in Helldivers 2 .

Nonetheless, armor customization itself would be a fun update to have in the future, with players theoretically being able to make quaint, predetermined cosmetic changes and swapping their default colors for generic patterns. Even if weapon or armor transmog never arrives in Helldivers 2 , it’ll be no less fun that players’ weapons can be leveled up, customized with various attachments, and splashed with colorway patterns. If nothing else, it’s always great to have another means of progression that players can pour their stagnant, hoarded requisition slips into.

Helldivers 2 does not feature transmog because the armor passive a player has is illustrated by the body armor’s appearance.

item.title: Viral Game Cookie Clicker is Finally Coming to Consoles
item.description:
Summary

  • Cookie Clicker, the immensely addictive idle game, is coming to all major consoles on May 22.
  • Created by a solo developer, the title has been popular since 2013.
  • The console version of Cookie Clicker includes 600 upgrades, permanent unlocks, multiple mini-games, and even a pettable dragon.

The viral idle game Cookie Clicker is officially headed to all major consoles, with its release set for May 22. Originally developed for browsers by Julien Thiennot in 2013, the cult hit is known for its immensely addictive gameplay loop, tasking players with simply making cookies. Cookie Clicker is currently available via Steam, which was released with the help of Playsaurus, for $4.99.

Cookie Clicker began as a browser-based game created by a solo developer, gaining massive popularity thanks to its absurd premise. Players' only job is to produce more cookies, eventually ending up with gazillions. As players accumulate cookies, they unlock upgrades and various automations that increase the number of cookies produced. While as pointless as Rock Simulator , the game has garnered a solid fan base over the years.

The console versions were teased by Thiennot on May 14, with Playsaurus officially announcing the new editions of the game with a trailer just hours later. As expected, the beloved gameplay of Cookie Clicker remains intact and as addictive as ever. Instead of clicking the mouse button, players can smash the X or A button, depending on the console, on PlayStation 4, PlayStation 5, Xbox One, Xbox Series X/S, and Nintendo Switch. Additionally, a Switch 2 version was confirmed by the trailer. The game is priced at $4.99, as it is on Steam.

Cookie Clicker Brings One of the Most Addictive Gameplay Loops to Consoles

The console version of Cookie Clicker introduces over 600 upgrades, permanent unlocks, multiple mini-games, and even a pettable dragon. The game takes players from clicking to produce cookies one at a time to having cookie factories to mass produce, wizard towers to summon cookies, and much more. Music is provided by the original Minecraft composer C418, adding an unexpectedly excellent soundtrack to complement the monotony of endless clicking.

The game is an ingenious piece of engineering, presenting players with a seemingly simple task that becomes more complex with each upgrade purchased. The exponentially increasing cookie numbers are addictive, and upgrades serve Cookie Clicker players fresh challenges continuously. Increasing the number of cookies made eventually becomes a seemingly impossible task as numbers continue to climb and player options expand without an end in sight.

There are tons of options on the market, but not many idle games are as iconic as Cookie Clicker . While more comprehensive and perhaps more imaginative idle games have been released, Cookie Clicker is one of the original titles responsible for popularizing the genre. Many clicker games like Universal Paperclip and Cell to Singularity owe a lot to Cookie Clicker , which remains popular after more than a decade since its original release.
